1.label: Operating pushbutton(s) for dimmer
1.description: This parameter specifies which pushbutton(s) that shall be used to control the built-in dimmer.

options.label: No local operation of the dimmer
Pushbutton 1 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 2 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 3 controls the dimmer
Pushbutton 4 controls the dimmer

2.label: Duration of dimming
2.description:
This parameter specifies the duration ofa full regulation of the light from 0% to 100%.
        0:        Immediately.
        1-127:    Durationin seconds (Default is 5 seconds).
        128-255:  Duration in minutes (minus 127) from 1 –128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.

3.label: Duration of on/off
3.description:
This parameter specifies the duration when turning the light on or off.
        0:        Immediately. (Default).
        1-127:    Time in seconds.
        128-255:  Time in minutes (minus 127) from 1 –128 minutes, where 128 is 1 minute.

4.label: Dimmer mode
4.description: The dimmer can work in three different modes: on/off, leading edge or trailing edge.

options.label: No dimming, only on/off (0%/100%)
Trailing edge dimming
Leading edge dimming

5.label: Dimmer minimum level
5.description: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 0%.

6.label: Dimmer maximum level
6.description: This parameter specifies the actual level of the dimmer output when set to 99%.

7.label: Central Scene notifications
7.description: This parameter can be used for disabling Central Scene notifications.

options.label: Notifications are disabled
Notifications are enabled

8.label: Double-activation functionality
8.description: This parameter specifies the reaction when double-activating the pushbuttons.

options.label: Double-activation disabled
Double-activation sets light to 100%

10.label: Enhanced LED control
10.description: This parameter can be used for enabling the enhanced LED control. See document about MATRIX enhanced LED control.

options.label: Enhanced LED control is disabled
Enhanced LED control is enabled

11.label: Pushbutton debounce timer
11.description:
Pushbutton input debounce time in 0.01 seconds resolution.
			  1-255:  1–2.55 seconds. Default is 5, which equals to a debounce-filter on 50 milliseconds (0.05 seconds).

12.label: Pushbutton press threshold time
12.description:
Specifies the time that apushbuttonmust be activated before it is detected as pressed. Resolution is in 0.01 seconds.
			  1-255:  1–2.55 seconds. Default is 20, which equals to 200 milliseconds (0.2 seconds).

13.label: Pushbutton held threshold time
13.description:
Specifies the time that a pushbutton must have been activated before it is accepted as “held-down”. Resolution is 0.01 seconds.
			  1-255:  1–2.55 seconds. Default is 50, which equals to 500 milliseconds (0,5 seconds).

14.label: Global brightness control
14.description:
Byte 1: Red brightness
            0-255 Brightness level for the red colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255).
        Byte 2: Green brightness
            0–255 Brightness level for the green colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255).
        Byte 3: Blue brightness
            0-255 Brightness level for the blue colour in the 4 indicator groups (Default is 255).
        Byte 4: Not used–must be set to 0.
        Default: 4294967040

15.label: Associations groups, transmission when included secure
15.description:
This parameter specifies if commands are transmitted as a secure message for each of the association groups.
        Bitmask:
        0: All messages in all groups are sent as insecure.
        1: Messages in association group 2 aresent as secure.
        2: Messages in association group 3 aresent as secure.
        4: Messages in association group 4 aresent as secure.
        8: Messages in association group 5 aresent as secure.
        16: Messages in association group 6 aresent as secure.
        32: Messages in association group 7 aresent as secure.
        64: Messages in association group 8 aresent as secure.
        128: Messages in association group 9 aresent as secure.
        256: Messages in association group 10 aresent as secure.
        512: Messages in association group 11 aresent as secure.
        1024: Messages in association group 12 aresent as secure.
        2048: Messages in association group 13 aresent as secure.
        4096: Messages in association group 14 aresent as secure.
        8191: Messages in allassociation groups are sent as secure. (Default)

16.label: Pushbutton 1 functionality
16.description: This parameter specifies the functionality of pushbutton 1.

options.label: Standard toggle-function, the state is switched between on and off, dimming up and down
Automatic turn off after the time has expired (staircase lighting function), the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
Automatic turn on after the time has expired, the time is specified in the next configuration parameter
Always turn offor dim down. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘off’ or ‘dim down’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 4
Always turn on or dim up. Using this parameter, the pushbutton can only send ‘on’ or ‘dim up’ commands. Use this in pair with another pushbutton with value 3

17.label: Timer value for pushbutton 1
17.description: 0–43200: Specifies the time in seconds. Default is 300 = 5 minutes.

18.label: Multi-Level Switch Set values for pushbutton 1
18.description:
Byte 1: Enable/ Disable
            0 Disabled – A single activation of the pushbutton will not send commands to devices in association group 4.
            1 Enabled – A single activation will send commands to devices in association group 4. Devices will receive commands with the values set in Byte 2 and 3 (Default).
        Byte 2: Upper switch value
            0–99, 255 When single pressing the pushbutton for ON, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 255).
        Byte 3: Lower switch value
            0-99 When single pressing the pushbutton for OFF, a Multilevel Switch Set with this value will be send to devices in association group 4 (Default = 0).
        Byte 4: Not used–must be set to 0.
        Default: 33488896

19.label: Binary Switch Setsupport for pushbutton 1
19.description: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Setcommands are handled.

options.label: Binary Switch Set - only controls the pushbutton indicator LEDs, ON/OFF
Binary Switch Set - controls the internal switch status and the pushbutton indicator LEDs
Binary Switch Set - is handled as if the user had activated the pushbutton, including transmission of commands via the association groups

20.label: Pushbutton 1 LED indication
20.description: This parameter specifies how the LED indication is controlled..

options.label: Internal LED control is disabled, only external commands control the indication
The LED indication follows the switch status
The LED indication follows the switch status – with inverted functionality
Same as 1
Same as 2
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer, ON or OFF
The LED indication follows the status of the internal dimmer with inverted functionality, ON or OFF
The LED indicator is ON for 5 seconds when the pushbutton is activated

21.label: Colour commands for pushbutton 1 LED indication

options.label: Direct control - the LED indication shows the received colour immediately, until the pushbutton is activated
Colour command sets the colour for OFF indication
Colour command sets the colour for ON indication

21.description: This parameter specifies how received Binary Switch Set commands are handled.

22.label: ON indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
22.description:
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red
            0-255 Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs (Default is 0).
        Byte 2: Colour saturation, green
            0–255 Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs (Default is 0).
        Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue
            0-255 Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs (Default is 127).
        Byte 4: LED control
            0-255 LED indicator control - see the application note about this parameter (Default is 0).
        Default: 32512

23.label: OFF indication RGB-saturation for pushbutton 1
23.description:
Byte 1: Colour saturation, red
            0-255 Specifies the saturation for the red LEDs (Default is 47).
        Byte 2: Colour saturation, green
            0–255 Specifies the saturation for the green LEDs (Default is 47).
        Byte 3: Colour saturation, blue
            0-255 Specifies the saturation for the blue LEDs (Default is 47).
        Byte 4: LED control
            0-255 LED indicator control - see the application note about this parameter (Default is 0).
        Default: 50065152

2.label: Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #1 is used

3.label: Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #1 is used

4.label: Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #1 is used

5.label: Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #2 is used

6.label: Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #2 is used

7.label: Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #2 is used

8.label: Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #3 is used

9.label: Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #3 is used

10.label: Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #3 is used

11.label: Send Basic Report (On/Off) when button #4 is used

12.label: Sends Binary Switch Set (On/Off) when button #4 is used

13.label: Sends Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when button #4 is used

14.label: Send Basic Report with information about the actual level for the dimmer
